activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#11282
activity.text:
Hey @rithviknishad is it okay now?
Before:
![Screenshot 2025-03-14 230624](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/3d7476ff-6479-4029-bb49-71d9904f5dca)
After:
![Screenshot 2025-03-14 230313](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/c5f62184-3daa-4da5-a9b0-127fdd875f6d)
Also the video for clickable facility name:
https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/41c8277e-4f15-4f18-8088-854c441d7089
Should I make the facility name more interactive? It only has underline and cursor on hover right now.

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#11282
activity.text:
Hey @rithviknishad, I saw the alignment thing for small/mobile devices.
The changes I made in alignment in the pr were only for **medium and large screen devices.**
In this issue I only changed it to display the actual facility location name.
The alignment in location, date, time slot **was already there,** i thought it was intentionally like that. So did not think much of it.
The changes after changing the name to facility name did not introduce any new alignment issues for mobile devices that is why i ticked it in the merge checklist.
Really sorry if not confirming it with you caused further delays.
Would it be okay if I made changes in the alignment now?
Also there is 1 more issue where we are making this facility name clickable.
**I could also correct the alignment in that issue. (#11181). Would that work?**

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#10783
activity.text:
@rithviknishad @Jacobjeevan @nihal467 this is what we wanted right? Uniformity of organizations input tab with input tabs of others- users, patients, facilities.
2 things happen now-
-  Input tab clears whenever there is change in parent organization.
- Input field is restored whenever we come back from sub-organizations (stored in cache), since parent organization remains same.

Please suggest if any other changes are required.
Changed the code from saving local state of (id, page) to useFilters etc which is used in other tabs as well.

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/f7762e5c-aa1d-4d39-bd28-fc95eb098dc1

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#11114
activity.text:
Hello @Chinmayee-cd 
I have already updated the “Welcome back” text by removing the hardcoded string and replacing it with an i18n key in both en.json and hi.json. This change has been tested locally and is now displaying correctly in Hindi when the user switches the language.

**Next, I propose to:**
- Identify all remaining hardcoded English strings (e.g., “Choose your login method to continue,” “Patient Login,” “Staff Login,” etc.) within the login page and any related components.
- Add corresponding translation keys in both en.json and hi.json (and any other relevant language files).
- Replace the hardcoded text in the components with the translation function calls.
- Verify that all text updates properly when switching languages, and address any missing or incorrect translations.
- This approach ensures full localization coverage on the login page.

**Expected Timeline:**
- End date: 8th March

After changes:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/6d9a9999-dfca-4707-a4a4-24a995c34c86)

Kindly note the changes only for **Welcome back** for now. Will implement rest after confirmation.
